result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Larry Bendel Brazil Jr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Larry Bendel Brazil Jr in court.  Attorney Justin L. Singleton in court for Larry Bendel Brazil Jr.  Attorney Amy E Spanczak in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for Status conference.  Defense requests a projected guilty Plea hearing date. Co-Defendant Case 22CF240 is proceeding separately. Case adjourned to Br. 16.
Plea hearing scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Larry Bendel Brazil in court with attorney Justin L. Singleton.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Larry Bendel Brazil appeared by video means with Attorney. Defense is tabling motion at this time to further review discovery. Case is adjourned in Branch 16.  Status conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and filed; forwarded to the Judge for review.

Defendant Larry Bendel Brazil in court with attorney Justin L. Singleton.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Status Conference. All parties appeared via zoom. Discussion with parties regarding discovery issues. Court adjourns matter for an additional Status Conference date, due to reasons put forth on the record. Case adjourned to Br 16.Status conference scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Larry Bendel Brazil in court with attorney Justin L. Singleton.  Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Discussion with parties. Defense counsel advises that they have received discovery materials, but are still awaiting an offer from the state. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Status conference scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Larry Bendel Brazil in court with Attorney Thomas James; both appear by video.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State:  MPD Officer T. Kotnik.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading. Court enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Larry Bendel Brazil in court with Attorney Justin L. Singleton.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is out ill. Defense takes no position as to an adjournment. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant previously posted $5,300. Court orders $2000 cash bail to remain on the case and the rest be returned to the remitter. 
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in a manner and fashion as prescribed.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Larry Bendel Brazil in court with attorney Thomas James.  Kelly Hedge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
